Introduction
Full professor and reptile curator at the Museum of Zoology (QCAZ), Pontificia Universidad Católica del Ecuador. I am mostly interested in systematics and biogeography of Neotropical reptiles. My work involves morphological descriptions of new taxa, molecular phylogenies and reconstruction of ancestral distributions. I am currently working on descriptions of new species, molecular phylogenies and biogeographical analyses. As a side project, I am gathering physiological data of a few Ecuadorian lizards to assess the potential impact of global warming. Finally, I am in charge of the reptile section of Bioweb.bio, a resource-rich web portal to the biodiversity from Ecuador.

Projects

Projects (8)
Looking beneath the skin: Studies on the skeletal anatomy of amphibians, reptiles and small mammals
Project
The aim of this project is to provide detailed descriptions of the (cranial) osteology of a great diversity of amphibian, reptile and small mammal species and to contribute to the knowledge of the anatomy of these species via non-destructive computertomogaphy (CT) scan data. In several cases, CT data have provided crucial evidence for the diagnosis and delimitation of new species. The data reconstruction and analysis is done by use of diverse 3D rendering programs (e.g. Amira, Drishti, Meshlab, DataViewer, CT-Vox).
View
Floreana Island Ecological Restoration Project
Project
View
Reptiles of Ecuador: a free and resource-rich online portal, with dynamic checklists and photographic guides
Project
The high rate of species descriptions during recent decades, along with frequent taxonomic changes, has prevented printed checklists and books from maintaining a reasonably updated record of the species of reptiles from Ecuador. Here we present Reptiles del Ecuador (http://bioweb.bio/faunaweb/reptiliaweb), a free, resource-rich online portal with updated information on Ecuadorian reptiles. This interactive portal includes encyclopedic information on all species, multimedia presentations, distribution maps, habitat suitability models, and dynamic PDF guides.
